paragraphs.english: One day, after breakfast, Dae-yu, accompanied by Zi-quan, went to Grandmother’s side of the house to pay her respects and to take a break. When they left the Yueliang pavilion, Dae-yu suddenly remembered that she had forgotten her handkerchief, so she told Zi-quan to go back and fetch it. She then walked slowly, waiting for Zi-quan to catch up. When she reached the back of the bridge of Melted Snow, the place where she and Bo-bo had buried the flowers that day, she heard someone crying. Dae-yu stopped and listened, but she could not tell who it was or what she was crying about. She was very puzzled, so she went closer. When she got close, she saw that it was a pretty girl with thick eyebrows and big eyes crying there.

paragraphs.english:
The girl saw Dahuai coming and stopped crying. She got up and wiped her tears. Dahuai asked, "Why are you crying?" The girl heard this and burst into tears again, saying, "Lin Xiao, you have to judge this. They were talking, and I didn't know what they were talking about. I just said one wrong word, and my sister didn't have to hit me." Dahuai didn't understand what she was talking about and asked with a smile, "What's your sister's name?" The girl answered, "It's Pearl Sister." Dahuai then knew that she was from the room of the old lady. Dahuai asked again, "What's your name?" The girl answered, "I'm called the Stupid Sister." Dahuai laughed and asked, "Why did your sister hit you? What did you say wrong?" The girl answered, "Why? It's because of the marriage of our Baoer to Baoqian."
